description: Nikola Petrak, after reviewing confidential Council briefings and reports of unrest, authorizes implementation of the secret 'shadow compliance' protocol targeting restored citizens. The directive aims to maintain public order but increases Council liability and internal anxiety.

Under Nikola’s orders, the Council enacts 'shadow compliance,' subjecting the recently re-registered citizens to heightened surveillance and silent restrictions through the BCI. Internal circulars stress secrecy and rapid deployment, but leaks begin among lower-level staff.
Journalist Rada, alerted by abrupt hardships faced by newly restored residents, uncovers evidence of systematic discrimination. Her reporting sparks renewed outrage in former protest neighborhoods.

Oksana, an insider, leaks internal memos exposing 'shadow compliance' and elevated restrictions secretly imposed on restored citizens. Widespread panic grows in targeted zones as people realize the restoration was a cover for new controls.

Public anger boils over. Massive protests demand abolition of the BCI, revealing deep Council and Directorate complicity. Underground resistance networks form, organizing erased citizens and supporters beyond system surveillance.
